question.questionText: Which of these processes are involved in causing rain? A. evaporation B. condensation C. both evaporation and condensation. Explain your answer.

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Water evaporates to form vapor. The vapor condenses to form raindrops.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: The reason condensation makes rain is because a lake evaporates and then it condenses and then it rains back into the lake.
Evaporation because when water evaporates it is the water that will become rain and if water did not evaporate there would be no rain.

Both evaporation and condensation are processes that involve causing rain because first, when there is a cup of water, the sun would evaporate the water and turn it into water vapor, then the water vapor would touch a cool surface and start condensation. Then the condensation would go to the clouds and cause rain.
Because first it evaporates then it turns into condensation then it rains.
Condensation is involved in causing rain is because when rain falls it is called precipitation and then falls on a cool surface and that is called condensation.
Well when the water is anywhere evaporation picks up the water and turns it into water vapor and so on and so on.
Because evaporation evaporates goes up in the air and makes clouds forms a bigger cloud and that cloud gets role of water and then it rains.
Because evaporation and condensation can go into the clouds.

Because water evaporates and makes condensation and condensation makes clouds and clouds make rain.
Because but evaporation is air condensation is like cloud and rain.
Because evaporation causes the water to go up in the air, and condensation makes clouds which eventually form precipitation or rain.
Evaporation evaporates water into clouds. Condensation makes clouds.
Because water gets evaporated.

They both have something to do with rain because evaporation evaporates the water into the air and makes it water vapor. The water vapor condenses and makes clouds filled with water and then the cloud touches a cool surface and condensation makes the liquid water back into water and it rains.
I chose C evaporation and condensation because one cannot happen without the other.
I picked a because that is it causes rain.
They are both involved because water evaporate to the clouds, the it rains, then it condensates.
Because water will evaporate from a cool place and water vapor will go into the clouds and will hit a cool place and form condensation.
The reason why I chose this answer is because condensation causes fog.
Evaporation and condensation happen in the rain because the water evaporates from the ground and hits a cooler surface and turns into condensation.
I choose this answer because in the water cycle from the ocean some water evaporates into a cloud until it cannot hold it anymore and then it rains.
Evaporation is a process involving rain because the water evaporates and turns into clouds.
I picked A because the water evaporates then goes into the cloud that cools it down then it rains then it starts all over again.
Evaporation in the sky it evaporation into the sky it make rain.
I think C. Because water evaporates and goes in the clouds and falls down as rain.
Both evaporation and condensation are involved in causing rain. Evaporation forms clouds and condensation makes it rain.
Because evaporation is when water goes into the air.
The water from lakes, rivers, oceans, canals, evaporates into the clouds and when the clouds get full of water it rains.
Because the air in the cloud condensed into rain and the rain came down on the earth.

You need both, evaporation and condensation to make it rain. It goes like this. First it rains, second the water goes into the ocean. The water heats up and evaporates in the air. Then in the clouds it cools. Then it condenses and rains again.
When water evaporates it goes to the clouds and the cloud gets heavy and it rains.
Evaporation is when the water vapor goes into the clouds. Condensation is when the water vapor turns into water.

Evaporation and condensation are both involved in causing rain. Because, to have clouds water has to evaporate. And to rain the water in the cloud gets too heavy so it rains that is called condensation.
Because the water cycle says it warms up, evaporates through the clouds, and cools, then it is condensation.
I picked C. Because to cause rain it would have to have both evaporation and condensation.
It needs evaporation to get the water, then the clouds soak it all up until it cannot hold any more. Then when it rains it is called condensation.
Because the water needs to evaporate and go into the clouds or air to fall down and make condensation.
Because evaporation makes the cloud, while condensation lets the cloud lose water.
First water has to evaporate into the air. When it builds up in the clouds it rains.
Because to get water in the clouds you need water vapor which is evaporated and then to get rain you need condensation.
To get the rain water into clouds, the water has to evaporate into vapor. As clouds to make rain come down the vapor has to condense. Then rain falls and the process starts over.
In order to rain you need evaporation because the water evaporates into the air and you need condensation to rain it down.
Both evaporation and condensation, because, evaporation forms condensation which goes to the clouds and then the clouds rain and then the process starts over again.
Evaporation turns water in water vapor so water vapor get in the clouds. Condensation make water vapor turns into water and rain.
How it rains is it evaporates and then it rains from the clouds.
To make rain clouds you need water, water vapor is water that has been evaporated.
When evaporation it up in the air when the air cools and then water to water condensation and fall to the ground as rain.

Since when water evaporates it goes in clouds then when it condenses and it comes down as rain.
Because you need condensation in the clouds for it to rain and if it does not evaporate it will not be able to rain.
Because condensation is when water vapor changes to water which is rain. Evaporation is when water changes to water vapor going up to the clouds.
Because the water on the ground evaporated became water vapor came to the clouds, the water condensed plus rained.
Because when it is water vapor it turns into rain back into water.

Because you need the water to evaporate then condensation makes it turn back into water and then it rains.

C, because you have to have the whole cycle for rain to happen.
Evaporation and condensation have to happen so precipitation can happen.
Because evaporation gets the water up into the air and condensation makes the water vapor drops of water and soon after that it rains.

Because, water has to evaporate to create clouds, and condensate to rain.

Both evaporation and condensation because they both have to do something with rain.
